dempred.datastructure

Class DatasetNormalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • dempred.datastructure.DatasetNormalizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DatasetNormalizer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Class DatasetNormalizer. This class is used to normalize a dataset. In general features of a dataset are transformed such that they have a mean of zero and a standart variation of one. But other normalizations are also common. It is crucial to transform the prediction set with the same values used to normalize the training set.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public DatasetNormalizer(Dataset<?> dataset)

    • Method Detail

      • train

        public void train(Dataset<?> dataset)
        Train is used to extract the mean and std vector of a given dataset. All indices that have a standard variation of zero are saved in the zero indices vector
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset

      • normalize

        public void normalize(Dataset<?> dataset)
        Normalizes a given dataset with mean and standard values extracted from train process. Indices saved in zeroIndices are removed from the dataset.
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset

      • prune

        public void prune(int[] indices)
        Given an integer array of zero indices the mean and standard vector are pruned by these values. That is all indices noted in indices vector are removed from these vectors.
        Parameters:
        indices - the indices
